value.title: Insert and query data in your Azure Cosmos DB database
value.excerpt: Discover the Azure Cosmos DB Data Explorer tool that enables you to add or modify data. Create stored procedures in JavaScript.

value.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
value.excerpt: Learn how to create SQL elastic pools and how to use them to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

value.title: Back up and restore your Azure SQL database
value.excerpt: Protect the data in your Azure SQL database and recover from data loss or corruption with backup and restore.

value.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the Text Analytics API and Azure Functions to discover what your customers are really saying in their feedback about your products or brands.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
value.excerpt: This module is a no-code introduction to PostgreSQL on Azure, including an explanation of particular problems that using Azure Database for PostgreSQL can solve. At a high level, we show how the components fit together and identify situations where you should use Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

value.title: Develop and configure an ASP.NET application that queries an Azure SQL database
value.excerpt: Create an Azure SQL database to store data for an application, and create an ASP.NET application to query data from the database.

value.title: Introduction to data platform modernization
value.excerpt: Introduction to data platform modernization

value.title: Migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure Database for MySQL
value.excerpt: "Migrate on-premises MySQL to Azure Database for MySQL"

value.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

value.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances
value.excerpt: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure Managed Instances

value.title: Optimize the performance of Azure Cosmos DB by using partitioning and indexing strategies
value.excerpt: Learn how to measure the performance of your NoSQL Azure Cosmos DB database, by monitoring, partitioning, and indexing

value.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances
value.excerpt: Learn how to run and troubleshoot containerized apps using Docker containers with Azure Container Instances.

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Cosmos DB with Scott Hanselman
value.excerpt: Kirill Gavrylyuk stops by Azure Friday to talk Cosmos DB with Scott Hanselman. Watch quick overview of the industry's first globally distributed multi-model database service followed by a demo of moving an existing MongoDB app to Cosmos DB with a single config change.  For more information, see: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/cosmos-db/.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4fRKzcU__jY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Common design patterns with Azure Cosmos DB | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Aravind Krishna stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman and take a look at common design patterns for building highly scalable solutions with Azure Cosmos DB. We will talk a little bit about modeling data and how to choose an appropriate partition key. We then look at a few patterns like event sourcing,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5YNJpGwj_Zs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to partition your data in Azure Cosmos DB | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Carey MacDonald stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman about Azure Cosmos DB, a managed database service with unlimited horizontal scale, allowing you to scale storage and throughput independently.   In this video, Carey will cover how to partition your data in Azure Cosmos DB, best practices for choosing
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/UZiccUhvWKE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Scale Your Cloud App with Azure Cache for Redis | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Ye Gu joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Cache for Redis, a popular open-source in-memory data store that uses DRAM to store the most frequently used or time-sensitive data for fast retrieval. With it, you can create applications on Azure that handle millions of requests per second at down to sub-millisecond
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/K7_gnzge6Oc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Deploy and configure servers, instances, and databases for Azure SQL

value.title: Secure your data with Azure SQL
value.excerpt: Secure your data with Azure SQL

value.title: Back up and restore databases
value.excerpt: Plan and implement policy for recovering data in case of user error or failure of technology. Explore various options for how and where to backup and restore databases.

value.title: Choose the appropriate API for Azure Cosmos DB
value.excerpt: Compare the different APIs that are available in Azure Cosmos DB, highlighting and contrasting the different scenarios that would make them a good choice for a company.

value.title: Configure SQL Server resources for optimal performance
value.excerpt: Choose the appropriate size and storage options for your Azure SQL databases. Configure server resources such as tempdb. Understand the usage of Resource Governor.

value.title: Deploy Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Provision and deploy Azure SQL Database and SQL Server Managed Instances. Select the appropriate options when performing a migration to the SQL PaaS platform.

value.title: Design a geographically distributed application
value.excerpt: Build an application that spans multiple geographic locations for high availability and resiliency.

value.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines
value.excerpt: Use a release approval in Azure Pipelines to help coordinate database schema changes between developers and database administrators.

value.title: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases
value.excerpt: Migrate SQL Workloads to Azure SQL Databases

value.title: Secure your Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Secure an Azure SQL database to keep the information safe and diagnose potential security concerns as they happen.

value.title: Debugging and optimizing Azure Cosmos DB performance | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Deborah Chen joins Scott Hanselman to share some best practices on how to debug and optimize Azure Cosmos DB for better performance. Watch as they go through the common issues newcomers to Azure Cosmos DB run into with respect to performance and how to solve them by tuning Request Unit (RU) cost and
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IkCKGX6jbN4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to use the Gremlin API with Azure Cosmos DB | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jayanta Mondal stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman about Gremlin, the traversal query language for Cosmos DB graph. Gremlin being a dataflow language and procedural is nature, writing efficient Gremlin queries requires the knowledge of graph structure and the query execution plan.   Learn how to structure
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/DAF8JIUUQvI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introducing Flexible Server in Azure Database for PostgreSQL & MySQL | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Sunil Kamath joins Scott Hanselman to discuss how you can run your MySQL or Postgres database as a managed database on Azure without giving up the control you want while taking advantage of the benefits of a PaaS offering.  0:00 – Overview 4:44 – Demo 8:54 – Customizing Flexible Server in the CLI 10:41

value.title: Automate tasks in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Scripting repetitive tasks in Azure SQL for regular maintenance jobs and multi-instance administration. Automation of error and resource alerts. Configuration of notifications for failures.

topItems.title: Configure automatic deployment for Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Utilize Azure Resource Manager templates for deploying Azure SQL resources.

topItems.title: Schedule tasks using SQL Server Agent
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for scheduled tasks and automatic alerts for SQL Server and Managed Instance. Configure extended event sessions for tracing activities.

topItems.title: Manage Azure PaaS resources using automated methods
topItems.excerpt: Explore SQL automation for Azure SQL Database and Open Source databases. Configure elastic jobs and Azure Policy.
